title: How to Get the Mythical Monster Cherubble in My Singing Monsters

steps.title: Obtain some parent monsters.
steps.content: Obtain some parent monsters. Cherubble can be bred with two combinations: a Congle and a Woolabee on Fire Oasis, or a Cataliszt and a Cherubble on Mythical Island. If you don't already have a Cherubble and are having trouble finding one elsewhere, find and obtain a Congle and a Woolabee. [1] X Research source In order to get to Fire Oasis, you must purchase it with 750,000 Coins after unlocking Earth Island. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Level the parents to level 4.
steps.content: Level the parents to level 4. Monsters must be at least level 4 to breed, so level up your Congle and Woolabee if they're not already at least level 4. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Upgrade your Breeding Structures, if you wish.
steps.content: Upgrade your Breeding Structures, if you wish. While not necessary, you can upgrade your Breeding Structures to reduce breeding times by 25%. You can upgrade your structure by spending 25 diamonds. You can also add Wishing Torches around your Breeding Structure to help increase the odds of a rare monster being bred. [4] X Research source Wishing Torches can be lit for 24 hours by paying 2 diamonds or be lit permanently by paying 100 diamonds.

steps.title: Breed the parent monsters.
steps.content: Breed the parent monsters. Once you're ready to breed your monsters, put them in the Breeding Structure. A Cherubble egg is blue with multicolored speckles on it, similar to a Cherubble.. [5] X Research source Make sure to breed outside of a Rare monster availability window. If there is an event going on that allows Rare monsters to be bred, you could end up breeding a Rare Congle, Rare Woolabee, Rare Tweedle, or Rare Mammott with a combination of a Congle and a Woolabee. This will decrease your chances that the Congle and Woolabee will breed a Cherubble. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for your Cherubble to hatch.
steps.content: Wait for your Cherubble to hatch. It will take 18 hours to hatch, or 13 hours and 30 minutes if you've upgraded your breeding structure.
